title: Honoring Dr. Hal Teitelbaum upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition by the Middletown NAACP
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Dr. Hal Teitelbaum upon the occasion of
his designation for special  recognition  by  the  Middletown  NAACP  on
Saturday, October 23, 2010

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Hal Teitelbaum has given not only of his time  and  ener-
gies  but also of his competence, intelligence and leadership and conse-
quently has been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor  Dr.  Hal
Teitelbaum  upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition
by the Middletown NAACP at a celebration to be held at the Spruce  Lodge
Manor, Montgomery, New York, on Saturday, October 23, 2010; and
  WHEREAS,  Hal Teitelbaum, MD, MBA, Managing Partner and CEO of Crystal
Run Healthcare, is being recognized for his dedicated community service,
devoted volunteerism, and philanthropic deeds, as well as his leadership
skills that have had a positive impact in both the Orange  and  Sullivan
communities; and
  WHEREAS,  Crystal Run Healthcare is among the largest, fastest growing
and most technically advanced medical practices in New York State; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Hal Teitelbaum completed his training in  Internal  Medi-
cine at New York Hospital-Cornell Medical Center, and in Medical Oncolo-
gy and Hematology at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center; and
  WHEREAS,  After  beginning  his career in full-time academic practice,
Dr. Hal Teitelbaum established a solo practice in 1982, in Orange  Coun-
ty, New York; he then established Crystal Run Healthcare in 1996; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Hal  Teitelbaum is a 1998 graduate of Columbia Business
School, and was recently admitted to the Columbia Law School,  Class  of
2012; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Hal  Teitelbaum  has been called upon to contribute his
time and talents to countless civic and  charitable  endeavors  and  has
always given of himself unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS,  He  has served on the board of Horton Hospital and of Elant,
and has been the recipient of the  ADL  Americanism  Award,  the  Rhulen
Award  of  the Sullivan County Partnership for Economic Development, and
the Alliance for Balanced Growth's 'Golden Shovel Award' of  the  Orange
County Partnership; and
  WHEREAS,  Furthermore,  he was recognized by the Medical Group Manage-
ment Association (MGMA) as the 2006 Physician  Executive  of  the  Year;
most  recently, Dr. Teitelbaum was among the nominees for MODERN HEALTH-
CARE and MODERN PHYSICIAN magazines'  lists  of  the  50  Most  Powerful
Physician Executives in Healthcare; and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  the  entire  period  of his community service, a
period  of  constructive  involvement,  Dr.  Hal  Teitelbaum  has  stood
constant in dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individ-
ual  for  the  benefit  of others which Dr. Hal Teitelbaum has displayed
throughout his life; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Dr.  Hal  Teitelbaum  upon  the  occasion  of his designation for
special recognition by the Middletown NAACP  on  Saturday,  October  23,
2010; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Dr. Hal Teitelbaum.
